defun c.description: define a lisp function as AutoCAD command

(defun c.description: define a lisp function as AutoCAD command

getvar.description: Retrieves the value of an AutoCAD system variable

princ.description: Prints an expression to the command line, or writes an expression to an open file

print.description: Prints an expression to the command line, or writes an expression to an open file

prin1.description: Prints an expression to the command line, or writes an expression to an open file

polar.description: Returns the UCS 3D point at a specified angle and distance from a point

prompt.description: Displays a string on your screen's prompt area

setq.description: Sets the value of a symbol or symbols to associated expressions

setvar.description: Sets an AutoCAD system variable to a specified value

strcat.description: Returns a string that is the concatenation of multiple strings

ssget.description: Creates a selection set from the selected object

substr.description: Returns a substring of a string

itoa.description: Returns the conversion of an integer into a string

tblsearch style.description: Searches a symbol table for a symbol name

abs.description: Returns the absolute value of a number

alert.description: Displays a dialog box containing an error or warning message

alloc.description: Sets the size of the segment to be used by the expand function

angle.description: Returns an angle in radians of a line defined by two endpoints

apply.description: Passes a list of arguments to, and executes, a specified function

append.description: Takes any number of lists and appends them together as one list

ascii.description: Returns the conversion of the first character of a string into its Unicode character code (an integer)

assoc.description: Searches an association list for an element and returns that association list entry

atan.description: Returns the arctangent of a number in radians

atof.description: Converts a string into a real number

atoi.description: Converts a string into an integer

atoms-family.description: Returns a list of the currently defined symbols

boundp.description: Verifies if a value is bound to a symbol

car.description: Returns the first element of a list

caddr.description: Verifies if a value is bound to a symbol

cons.description: Adds an element to the beginning of a list, or constructs a dotted list

chr.description: Converts an integer representing an Unicode character code into a single-character string

entmake.description: Creates a new entity in the drawing

entmod.description: Modifies the definition data of an object (entity)

eq.description: Determines whether two expressions are identical

equal.description: Determines whether two expressions are equal

expt.description: Returns a number raised to a specified power

while.description: Evaluates a test expression, and if it is not nil, evaluates other expressions; repeats this process until the test expression evaluates to nil

write-line.description: Writes a string to the screen or to an open file

foreach.description: Evaluates expressions for all members of a list

repeat.description: Evaluates each expression a specified number of times, and returns the value of the last expression

read-line.description: Reads a string from the keyboard or from an open file, until an end-of-line marker is encountered

reverse.description: Returns a copy of a list with its elements reversed

nth.description: Evaluates each expression a specified number of times, and returns the value of the last expression

vl-string-left-trim.description: Removes the specified characters from the beginning of a string

vl-string-trim.description: Removes the specified characters from the beginning and end of a string

vl-string-search.description: Searches for the specified pattern in a string
